title: CJ IHC makes various administrative changes after addition of three more judges
content:
ISLAMABAD, Feb 04 (APP):The Chief Justice Islamabad High Court (IHC) had made various changes at administrative level after the addition of three new judges.
The chief justice has appointed Justice Sardar Sarfraz Dogar as administrator of Anti-Terrorism Courts (ATC) and National Accountability Courts (NAB). Previously, Justice Mohsin Akhtar Kayani was the administrator judge of these courts.
Similarly, Justice Muhammad Azam Khan is appointed the administrative judge of district courts (west) Islamabad. As per the office orders, Justice Arbab Muhammad Tahir has been appointed as administrative judge of FIA courts and Justice Saman Rafat Imtiaz is made administrative judge of banking courts.
